ETYMOLOGY: Coined in 1787 by Robert Barker, from Greek 'pan-' (all) + 'horama' (view).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun (a word that refers to a person, place, thing, event, substance, or quality)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A wide, unobstructed view of an extensive area in all directions.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: From the mountaintop, we enjoyed a breathtaking panorama of the valley below.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 从山顶上，我们欣赏到了下方山谷令人惊叹的全景。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun + preposition (a word that refers to a person, place, thing, event, substance, or quality + a word or group of words used before a noun, pronoun, or noun phrase to show direction, time, place, location, spatial relationships, or to introduce an object)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A comprehensive survey or presentation of a subject, topic, or sequence of events.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 对某一主题或一系列事件的全面概述或展示。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The documentary offered a fascinating panorama of 20th-century history.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这部纪录片展现了20世纪历史的迷人全景。
